website_summaries.verdict: Although it's not the best pick for large gardens with challenging soil, this mid-level tiller is a capable, easy-to-use garden tool that works well for many home gardeners' needs.
pros: Earns high marks in terms of convenience, as it's easy to assemble, start, and use
Lightweight and perfect for small, raised flower beds
Sturdy build with a 33cc 2-cycle Viper engine
cons: Not powerful enough to work in hard or clay soil, and not the best pick for large gardens

customer_reviews.title: For once you pay a good price for what they say it is
customer_reviews.text: This thing is everything that it's advertised to be. Easy to start easy to assemble and oh it runs so good! I use it for a garden about 100 by 54 between plants and between tight Rose. So maybe the best way to run it is do it like a vacuum cleaner in front of you as you. it goes deep enough thanks to the adjustable arm that acts as a drag pool sleep times down into the soil. I could not brag on this thing more for how I use it!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis K. Darrow

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tiller for raised beds!
customer_reviews.text: This little tiller is awesome! I needed to replace a 35+ year old name brand small tiller, and took a chance on this one. I am very pleased with it! It was a cinch to assemble, started easily, and really worked up the soil in my raised beds - maybe 5 minutes to till an 8 to 10’ x 4’ section at least 5” deep. FAR less difficult to use than the tiller it replaced (at a lower cost, too!)
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Small Garden Tiller
customer_reviews.text: Shopped around for some time and finally tried this one. Not a huge garden area but then again not a small one either. This thing has alot of power and works great. Highly recommend. The only very small piece of criticism would be that it could use a little bit larger set of wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bechard

customer_reviews.title: Strong lil guy
customer_reviews.text: Did the job. Strong lik guy. Used to till the ground to plant grass seeds. We had a huge weed infested back yard. No regrets getting this.
customer_reviews.author: Bnard

customer_reviews.title: Earthquake 31635 MC33 Mini Tiller Cultivator review
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic, it works like a pro! Remember to pull the shaft pins and remove the tine discs when you want to clean out any root build up on the machine. You can carry it with one hand and stores most anywhere. Simple to use, starts like a gem! Best investment I have made in years!
customer_reviews.author: Kayaking Don

customer_reviews.title: So far So good
customer_reviews.text: My first tiller. Easy to assembly. After all the fuel/oil mixing. I followed the instruction in the manual and the tiller started on second pull. I let it run for a minute and turned it off. I started it again and work it in the garden at the back of my house for about 5 minutes. I am still learning how to maneuver it. But this will be very helpful for my garden than the manual way I have been cultivating the garden before.
customer_reviews.author: ADEBOWALE OLUSEGUN

customer_reviews.title: Nice tool for the job
customer_reviews.text: Not sure what stretch rating is, but this tool works great, almost perfect. I lost a wing nut because they say not to tighten too tightly.... id say to securely tighten on and then another partial turn. Also, its not as easy as my electric one at "going forward". You have to put handles almost straight up as to dig straight down for it to propel forward.
customer_reviews.author: JobDone916

customer_reviews.title: Best value
customer_reviews.text: Great little tiller. It tilled this in approximately 25 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Quality & Design
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived with what seemed to be good packaging. Upon opening the box I found that the handlebars were strapped to the blades which resulted in several scapes, dings in transit. In addition, the mounting nut located in the body of the throttle separated from the body preventing the throttle lever from being attached to the handle bars. Very poor quality and design.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer_66

customer_reviews.title: exellent and well made
customer_reviews.text: I have owned many tillers including a comparable 43 cc model.This is far superior. It is better made. It starts and runs better. It has ample power is well-designed and is superb for cultivating. It's more rugged and easier to use than a mantis and is much better made than an alternative 43 cc Model, which I also have and discarded because it would not run
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not have power to do my garden!
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect size for me however I am very disappointed in its job performance. My garden has red clay soil and this tool is not the best resource to tackle my garden. Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated or I must send it back. During this time of uncertainties I can not waste valuable income!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa clark

customer_reviews.title: It bounces too much.
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my flower bed. Could not use it because it would bounce into my flowers.
customer_reviews.author: I Want Trike

customer_reviews.title: Good machine
customer_reviews.text: This is good for small jobs and soft soil. Hard to break ground with. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Life

customer_reviews.title: Only if your soil is super soft
customer_reviews.text: This works well in soft soil that doesn't need tilling.
customer_reviews.author: Dezzi

customer_reviews.title: Still Hoping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item as I want to start a garden, but found it did not work well on hard dirt, but I will keep it and find a way to make it work and make my garden.
customer_reviews.author: The Patriot Texan

customer_reviews.title: Nice tiller for light garden/yard work.
customer_reviews.text: Nice tiller for light garden/yard work. Definitely worth the money. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K. Nowlan

customer_reviews.title: Small but Mighty
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and reasonably priced. Good quality. This little cultivator took care of tilling my entire back yard. I am a satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly S

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Its a nice tiller. The problems are the blades dulled father quick making it difficult to use
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Great for My Compost Pile
customer_reviews.text: It would not do a heavy duty job, but it's exactly what I need to keep my compost pile tilled up.
customer_reviews.author: Donnise

customer_reviews.title: pulled sholder!!
customer_reviews.text: VERY hard to start ., 12 pulls ! returned it and bought a honda , love it starts easy
customer_reviews.author: michael

customer_reviews.title: Great buy
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical,but that's a badass little machine. As long as the ground has already been turned,the earthquake will definitely mix up your fertilizer or whatever else you're doing. It also helps with the drainage in your garden. It did with mine anyways. This was well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL LITTLE MACHINE
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my new patio area...digging out the grass by hand with a shovel proved to be too much work.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Z.

customer_reviews.title: Small but mighty!
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what I wanted. Small enough for me to handle but saved me a lot of work. Used it to prep the ground for cement.
customer_reviews.author: mommaspeedy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hard working machine
customer_reviews.text: This machine helped me till my whole backyard. The thing works great
customer_reviews.author: Adam G

customer_reviews.title: Not working for us
customer_reviews.text: Not powerful enough for clay dirt:( wish we could return it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good value and most efficient to use.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight alternative to other tillers on the market and an exceptional value. I found it easy to use and it's performance could not be beat. I would recommend its purchase over other alternatives.
customer_reviews.author: charles churchill

customer_reviews.title: Not for tilling, only scuffs the surface inch or so
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really work well going forward. The tines stop turning with any downward pressure on the handle bars. Works okay pulling it backwards but only tills the surface
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little guy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my nephew. He says it’s great for its size
customer_reviews.author: Jan B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome power for a small unit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together. Runs amazing! Tons of power. Perfect for raised beds and small areas. I love products that are designed well. A rarity these days.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Help please
customer_reviews.text: Used twice now starts but wont rev up just boggs down
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Bryarly

customer_reviews.title: It’s worth the money for the output it delivers!
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done it’s just hard keep a good forward movement when you hit hard dirt
customer_reviews.author: Jlopez

customer_reviews.title: Hardworking little machine.
customer_reviews.text: Might need a second pair of hands to assemble this. Works great and has met all expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Bremer

customer_reviews.title: Works and handles great
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use. Both my husband and I are easily able to handle and maneuver it.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanna

customer_reviews.title: Light and easy
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses it in the garden and says it works well. He likes that it is light and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I've used this 3 times and it's comparable to the Mantis I had so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brock Anderson

customer_reviews.title: The 5 years warranty was best for me.
customer_reviews.text: I like it, its easy to assemble and was easy to start. I used it right away after assembling and adding fuel. It did a good job.
customer_reviews.author: RobertThompson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size to do in between rows
customer_reviews.text: Love the tiller,did what we needed it to do in our garden without having to use our big tiller
customer_reviews.author: jerry dumond

customer_reviews.title: Small yards under 1 acre
customer_reviews.text: Awesome perfect for small yards under 1 acre with flower beds
customer_reviews.author: Critter

customer_reviews.title: Weeding made easy!
customer_reviews.text: I put the handles on backward at first, as there was unclear instructions, but was easy to fix. Easy to start compared to others I have used, and didn't use too much gas.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Mini Cultivator
customer_reviews.text: Work's real good just like the one i barrow from a friend
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Moore

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product I am a small person and could handle it fine
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Marie Unger

product_meta.title: Earthquake 31452 MAC Tiller Cultivator, Powerful 33cc 2-Cycle Viper Engine, Gear Drive Transmission, Lightweight, Easy to Carry, 5-Year Warranty, Red
product_meta.description: Style:Non-WheeledThe Earthquake MAC is great for weeding, mixing and aerating your garden or flower bed soil. Weighing in at only 24lb, the MAC can easily be transported to your garden bed. When not in use, its stable upright “parking” stance allows for compact storage. The MAC stands at attention, ready to get back to work. The grips and handlebar tubes are positioned to give you the greatest amount of control. This enables you to remove the weeds, not your plants. The rigid U-Turn handlebar design reduces vibration and gives you a greater sense of confidence in your garden. In contrast to wheeled units, the MAC allows gardeners even clearer line of sight near and around plants and makes it a superior option for those primarily interested in the cultivating function. By removing the wheels, the MAC is also lighter than wheeled counterparts which contributes to even greater maneuverability and control. With a US based support team and industry leading 5-Year Warranty, this cultivator will perform for years to come.
feature_bullets: LIGHTWEIGHT: Weighing in at only 24lb, the MAC is easy to transport to your garden bed and offers superior maneuverability for cultivating tasks due to the removal of the wheels and drag stake.
STURDY: Its rigid U-Turn handlebar design softens vibration and gives you more control.
VERSATILE: The Earthquake MAC is great for weeding, mixing and aerating your garden or flower bed soil.

DESIGNED TO MANEUVER: The handlebar grips and handlebar tubes are positioned to give the operator greater control over where the tines go. We call this overhand control. This means less bouncing and sudden jerking when you encounter rough spots in the dirt like rocks and roots.

CONVENIENT: When not in use the MAC sits upright in its stable “parking” stance. It’s designed for compact storage or ready access in the garden to resume cultivating. MAC stands at attention ready to get back to work.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars119 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
